sen.j: 藤原 公実（ふじわら の きんざね、天喜元年（1053年）-嘉承2年11月14日 (旧暦)（1107年12月29日））は、平安時代の公卿、歌人。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Kinzane (November 14, 1053-December 29, 1107) was a court noble and poet of Heian period.

sen.j: 正二位大納言に至り、三条大納言と称す。
sen.e: He ended his career as Major Counselor, Second Senior Rank, and was known as the Sanjo Major Counselor.
sen.cmt: 後代（鎌倉時代）の人で同じく三条大納言と呼ばれた人がいたので、同じ名称とした。
sen.e: He ended his career as a major counselor, second senior rank, and was known as Sanjo (Major Counselor).
He ended his career as Dainagon (chief councilor of state), senior second rank, and was known as Sanjo Dainagon (chief councilor of state).

sen.j: 大納言藤原実季の長男で、母は藤原経平女。
sen.e: He was the oldest son of FUJIWARA no Sanesue, Major Counselor, and his mother was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Tsunehira.

sen.j: 閑院家の祖・太政大臣藤原公季の玄孫にあたる。
sen.e: He was also the great‐great‐grandson of the ancestor of the Kan'inke, the Grand Minister of State FUJIWARA no Kinsue.

sen.j: 弟妹に、藤原保実・藤原仲実と、藤原苡子（堀河天皇女御、鳥羽天皇生母）らがいる。
sen.e: Among his brothers and sisters were FUJIWARA no Yasuzane, FUJIWARA no Nakazane and FUJIWARA no Ishi (Emperor Horikawa's concubine and mother of Emperor Toba).

sen.j: 白河天皇とは従兄弟に当たるため朝廷の信任も篤く、堀河天皇に近臣として仕え、妻藤原光子は堀河・鳥羽二代の乳母となった。
sen.e: As Emperor Shirakawa was his cousin, he was deeply trusted by the imperial court and served Emperor Horikawa as a trusted vassal, his wife FUJIWARA no Mitsuko serving as a wet nurse for both Emperor Horikawa and Emperor Toba.
sen.cmt: 用語集では「ふじわらのこうし」とされていたが、その名前では平安初期の別人物しか確認できず。
sen.e: Because Emperor Shirakawa was his cousin, he was deeply trusted by the Imperial Court and served Emperor Horikawa as a trusted vassal, while his wife FUJIWARA no Mitsuko served as a wet nurse for the emperors Horikawa and Toba.

sen.j: 歌壇でも活躍し、長治2年(1105年)頃奏覧の『堀河院御時百首和歌』に出詠し、生前編纂された第四勅撰後拾遺和歌集の作者にもなった。
sen.e: He was also very active in poetic circles, composing a poem for the imperial collection of 1105, "Horikawa Hundred Poems" (Horikawa-in On-toki Hyakushu Waka), and his poem was also chosen for the Goshui wakashu, the fourth imperial anthology of waka poetry, edited while he was still alive.

sen.j: 公実の逸話として、嘉承2年（1107年）に甥が鳥羽天皇として即位した時、彼は摂関家の当主藤原忠実の若年なるを侮って、幼帝の外舅の地位にある自らこそ摂政に就任すべしと主張し、「四代もの間、諸大夫として仕えた者が今摂関を望むとは」と白河院別当の源俊明に一蹴されたという話がある。
sen.e: There is an anecdote about Kinzane that when his nephew acceded to the throne as Emperor Toba in 1107, he despised the youth of FUJIWARA no Tadazane, who was the head of the Fujiwara Regent's Line at that time, insisting that he himself, the father of the young emperor's wife, was appropriate as the emperor's Regent, but MINAMOTO no Toshiakira, the Superintendant of in the court of Retired Emperor Shirakawa, refused it, saying 'How foolish you are to desire to be Regent now, after serving as Shodaibu for four generations'.
sen.cmt: 引用出典では別当はそのままbettoだったが、他文献ではthe Superintendantとしているものが多かったため（藤原忠平参照）そちらに合わせた。
sen.e: There is an anecdote regarding Kinzane that when his nephew acceded to the throne as Emperor Toba in 1107, he despised the youth of FUJIWARA no Tadazane, who was the head of the Fujiwara regent's line, insisting that he himself, the father of the young Emperor's wife, was appropriate as the emperor's regent, but MINAMOTO no Toshiakira, the superintendant of the court of Retired Emperor Shirakawa, refused it, saying, 'How foolish you are to desire to be regent now, after serving as the shodaibu over four generations.'

According to an anecdote told about Kinzane, when his nephew acceded to the throne as Emperor Toba in 1107, Kinzane insisted that, as the father of the young Emperor's wife, he himself should become the emperor's regent rather than the head of the Fujiwara regent's line, FUJIWARA no Tadazane (who he despised for his youth), but MINAMOTO no Toshiakira, the superintendant of the court of the retired Emperor Shirakawa, refused his demand, saying, 'How foolish you are to desire to become regent now, having held the rank of shodaibu through four generations of emperors.'
sen.cmt: Retired→retiredより読みやすくなるように全般的に修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、公実の権勢は、その子供たちの出世にそのまま反映された（三条実行は太政大臣、徳大寺実能は右大臣、末娘藤原璋子は鳥羽天皇中宮）。
sen.e: However, Kinzane's power and influence were directly reflected in the success of his children.（Saneyuki SANJO became Great Minister of State, Saneyoshi TOKUDAIJI became Minister of the Right and the youngest daughter, FUJIWARA no Shoshi, became Empress to Emperor Toba.).
sen.cmt: 藤原璋子（ふじわらのしょうし）用語集には「Soshi」とあったが、生没年・父の名も違ったので、全くの別人と思われる。
sen.e: However, Kinzane's power and influence were directly reflected in the success of his children （Saneyuki SANJO became the grand minister of state, Saneyoshi TOKUDAIJI became the minister of the right and the youngest daughter, FUJIWARA no Shoshi, became the empress to Emperor Toba.).
